shared_text:
Vestavia Hills High School
August 11 at 9:25 PM ·

August 11, 2020 -- Over the past several days, Vestavia Hills High School athletics staff have been monitoring several students and coaches in the varsity football program who recently tested positive for COVID-19 or were in close contact with individuals who tested positive.

Based on the guidelines of the school system’s 2020 Reopening Plan, and in consultation with medical professionals associated with the team, Vestavia Hills High School is suspending varsity football practice through Thursday, August 20. All varsity football activities will resume on Friday, August 21.

Due to the inability of the team to practice for an extended period, the Rebels’ first two games against Homewood and Mountain Brook have been canceled. We intend to add a game to the team’s schedule during Week 5, which was originally scheduled to be an off week.

All other school athletics practices and events are taking place as scheduled.

post_text: Congratulations to these outstanding Pizitz students!
shared_text:
Louis Pizitz Middle School
June 2 at 1:32 PM ·

Each year, the American Association of Teachers of French puts on Le Grand Concours, a.k.a. the National French Contest. The test measures students' reading and listening proficiency in French at the level of their study and experience. Students in every U.S. state took part this year, and more 70,000 students participated.
Two Pizitz students finished with scores that rank first in the state and third in the nation--Isabella Seymour and Thomas Patton! In addition, Dana Cheek ranked just behind them at second in the state and 4th in the nation!
Jessica Ma, George Phillips, Carol Li, Gabi Ramirez and Luke Knight all were silver medal winners, with scores in the top ten of the state and nation. Jake Simpson and Chris Won were bronze medal winners, and Will Steur and Wyatt Long earned honorable mentions for their performances in the contest.
